title: Crude bomb explodes at Malibagh
body: A crude bomb was exploded near Fortune Shopping Mall in front of Mouchak Market at Malibagh in the capital Dhaka on Thursday evening. The crude bomb was exploded at about 7:30pm in the area under Ramna police station. Ramna police station duty officer sub-inspector Mamun said that some identified people on motorbike hurled a crude bomb near Fortune Shopping Mall and fled the scene immediately. No casualties were reported in the incident, said Mamun, adding that a police team rushed to the spot on information. CCTV footage from nearby buildings will be collected and examined to identify the troublemakers and to take actions against them, said police. The crude bomb was exploded about one hour and a half after the Election Commission announced the schedule for the 13th parliamentary elections and national referendum, setting February 12 as the polling day.
